titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the You Can't Beat the Dutch. Radio Program Series Phonorecords, 1941-1945
You Can't Beat the Dutch Phonorecords
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff; machine-readable finding aid created by Michael C. Conkin

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-02-20T08:20-0800

change.item: November 19, 2013: Descriptions of reformatted audiovisual items updated August 13, 2012: Revised to update encoding and add unitid by Jill Golden March 23, 2004: PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::You Can't Beat the Dutch. Radio Program Series Phonorecords)//EN" "youdutch.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

did.unittitle: You Can't Beat the Dutch. Radio Program Series Phonorecords,
did.abstract: Relates to Dutch military, naval, and aerial operations, and to the resistance in the German-occupied Netherlands.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. Use copies of some sound recordings, video recordings, or motion picture material in this collection are available for immediate access. To listen to other sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], You Can't Beat the Dutch. Radio Program Series Phonorecords, Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Relates to Dutch military, naval, and aerial operations, and to the resistance in the German-occupied Netherlands.

did.unittitle: Jungle Assignment - Lt. Commander X, Royal Netherlands Navy
I Saw Amersfoort - Marie de Witt
Cavalcade of Courage - Dr. Corydon Wassell, Lt. Commander, USNR
The Saga of the Old Lady - William Zernicke, Seaman
Wings over Hollandia - Major van Vliet, Royal Netherlands Indies Airforce
Sweep or Sink - Lt. Atwood George Serle, Royal Netherlands Navy
The Story of Surabaya - Captain Willem Heringa and Lt. Hein Heringa, R.N.N.
Jumping Joe, Pride of Paducah - Commander Joseph Clinton Clifton, U.S.N. Airforce
Heroine of the Catacombs - Lt. Denes Baylo, American Field Service
One-Woman League of Nations - Josephine Coates
The Log of the O-21 - Lt. Frans J. Kroesen, R.N.N.
Building a New Indonesia - Hon. Charles van der Plas, Acting Governor of Free Parts of Netherlands Indies
Indonesian Sidelights - Lt. Mohammed Mansoer, R.N.M.C.
Caribbean Patrol - Lt. Commander Emil Dankmeijer, R.N.N.
Two years with Dutch Underground - Sgt. Reiner Pietermaat, R.N.I.A.
Demand for Surrender - Major General N.L.W. van Straten, R.N.I.A.
Soldiers of the Sky - Major General Maxwell D. Taylor, U.S. Army, Commander of 101st Airborne Division
Holland Calling U.S.A. - L. de Jong and A. den Doolard (London)
The Dutch Lion Returns - Major A. Kerkhoven, R.N. Army
Underground in Germany - Jacob van Berkel
Special Easter Program,
Front Line Report - Arnold vas Dias, Managing Director ANETA, Dutch War Correspondent
The Useless Ijssel Wall - Captain General Gerard Schovers, R.N. Marine Corps
The Tale of the Travel Club - Commander Hans Winckel, R.N.N.
